In a statement, Cllr Skibsted said:
‚ÄúI will continue to serve the Orton Longueville ward in order to improve the lives of people of the area. I want to continue to ensure that the voices of Orton Longueville‚Äôs residents are heard loud and clear by the city‚Äôs administration.
‚ÄúI have been involved in many environmental and neighbourhood projects, demonstrating my absolute commitment to my local community. I will seek to continue this work beyond 2023.
‚ÄúThe Green Party‚Äôs policies and values can help create fairer greener communities. I feel I have found my home, because Green policies align much closer to my views and I feel part of a team working in the city‚Äôs interest with a spirit of collaboration. ‚ÄúWe are facing severe social and economic issues ‚Äì inflation and a cost of living crisis ‚Äì which are bearing down on low income families. We also continue to face a worsening climate crisis. Greens know that we can tackle the cost of living and the climate crisis in combination through, for example, insulating homes which will slash energy bills.‚Äù

‚ÄúI am delighted that Cllr Skibsted has chosen to join the Green Party. The Peterborough Green group on Peterborough City Council supported a new administration at the 1st of November council meeting. Peterborough first will lead this new administration, supported by Liberal Democrats, Labour and the Greens.
We believe that Peterborough deserves and needs and fresh approach after 23 years of Conservative administration. We are supportive of the new administration who have promised to deliver stability, better conduct and transparency. The public needs openness about the future of the Regional Pool, Green Spaces and the Hilton Hotel.
We trust that we can work together with our groups for the betterment of Peterborough and our residents. Peterborough First have also promised to continue to support Green Policies and strategies that we have been working on at the council.
We still have significant financial challenges ahead and we are still committed to working on those challenges with all parties.

The Peterborough Green Party are delighted to announce Cllr Nicola Day as their Peterborough Parliamentary Candidate. Cllr Day has been leading the way on climate change and environmental issues in the city and aims to highlight the Green party‚Äôs strong agenda on issues of social justice.
Nicola says ‚Äò I am extremely concerned for the most vulnerable in our city right now. With the huge hike in energy bills and rising food prices many people are suffering and are worried about turning on their heating. An inadequately heated house in winter can cause misery, dampness and ill-health. The Green party wants to see a windfall tax imposed on energy companies, which will be used to make our homes warmer and lead to energy bills being set back to October 2021 levels. We want to ensure energy companies are put back into the hands of the public through public ownership. I welcome the local community hubs which have been created by the council to offer warmth, support and advice. However, energy should be a right, and there is far more the government should be doing to make sure we are not freezing in our homes.
I want to see Peterborough thrive. We have some fantastic cultural assets like the cathedral, museum, art gallery and Flag Fen. We should make the most out of these places and ensure they are accessible to everyone. Our arts and history should be cared for and cherished.
